chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Valleri L Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay cost, fees, assessments and DNA surcharge by 06-19-15.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. TIME SERVED disposition

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valleri L Wallace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to Count 1:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to Count 2:  On State's motion court ordered the count dismissed and to be read in at sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court sentenced defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 100 days served; for a time served disposition.  Court ordered the DNA surcharges, and court costs, fees and assessments to be paid by 6-19-2015 to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
Victim impact statement, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form, and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Valleri L Wallace in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Valleri L Wallace in custody.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On State's motion court amended the single count to two misdemeanor counts.  Count 1 is amended to Resisting Officer under 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a) a Class A misdemeanor and charge Count 2 of disorderly conduct under 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) a Class B misdemeanor.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Valleri L Wallace not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to the latness of the hour and the unavailability of both counsel in the afternoon, plus ongoing negotiations, case is continued before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
TOT to Justice Point; no alcohol or controlled substances; drug testing; urine screens; no firearms or weapons.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Valleri L Wallace not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $750.00.

Attorney Alexjandro Lockwood appeared.  Defendant Valleri Wallace in custody and not in court.  No other appearances.    Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court is in jury trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 20 on 4-23-2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Valleri L Wallace not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial and defense counsel cannot come back this afternoon.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Court retained file.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED to $5,000 CASH.

Defendant Valleri L Wallace in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Valleri L Wallace in custody.  Paul Hauer for Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Valleri L Wallace in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Valleri L Wallace in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
